abstracts.cdata!:
The Tank Irrigation Modernization
            Project in Sri Lanka was achieved. The co financiers
            supervised the project regularly, and maintained excellent
            relations with the Government of Sri Lanka. The main lessons
            have been to: (i) carry out surveys and detailed designs and
            plan the construction of works adequately in advance to
            avoid implementation delays; (ii) allow sufficient time for
            construction in view of the limited time during which canals
            can be closed; (iii) prevent indiscriminate land and water
            use in the catchment areas which reduces inflow to the tanks
            and increases erosion; (iv) build confidence among farmers
            that water will arrive on time and will be distributed
            equitably; and (v) assure farmers that changes in cropping
            practices they are expected to make will get the necessary
            support from the agencies concerned. Although the warning
            has been sounded earlier, it is worth repeating here that
            the level and quality of support services provided to
            farmers may well determine the success of the project.
